alert.note: Alert for Eddy (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 09 at 8:01AM CST until November 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, with potential for small areas of higher amounts and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Norman, Clay and Wilkin Counties. In North Dakota, Eddy County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Uncertainty remains for the areas that could receive the heaviest snow and timing and coverage of freezing rain or sleet. This will create large spread in potential impacts, and the storm track could still shift.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
